(Requires attunement by a creature. The properties of this item are affixed to an item.)

This item is a @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.rules.JournalEntry.nniVtdJB1oyk5Sa3]{locus} and can be combined with other Loci per the @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.rules.JournalEntry.nniVtdJB1oyk5Sa3.JournalEntryPage.zI0VWGKnYZqz6sKd]{Combining Loci} rules.

An incredibly light weight, metal cube of a silvery metallic color. It is roughly the size of an adult human's hand and it appears perfect. So perfect in fact that it almost plays tricks on the eyes and causes one to question themselves.

While attuned, the Nirvana Cube magically merges with an item of your choice. This can be done during a short or long rest, requires 10 minutes to complete and it upon completion leaves a visible imperfection in the object as nothing is able to match the cube's perfection. Once completed, if applied to a weapon it becomes magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances.

Effect: Daily at dawn, roll a d20 and record the number as your Nirvana Number. Whenever you roll that number on any ability check, attack roll or saving throw you treat the number rolled as if it was a natural 20. Furthermore, if you roll a natural 20 on the d20 at dawn, then you can pick which number you wish to be treated as a natural 20. This effect most be rolled daily at dawn.

Special: If you roll your Nirvana Number when rolling with advantage or disadvantage you can always select it as your roll.

Note: This can be applied to magical hand wraps, brass knuckles and other similar items that would represent Unarmed Strikes. The Unarmed Strikes would the be considered the weapon and these Unarmed Strikes would be what benefits from the item.
